question.title: Spring Boot 3 + Spring Security 6: 403 Forbidden when sending POST from Postman (stateless API)
question.body:
I’m testing a POST endpoint of a stateless API (no sessions/forms) and Postman returns 403 Forbidden. I suspect CSRF, but I’m not sure how to configure it correctly in Security 6 for a stateless REST API.

MRE (minimal code)

// ItemDto.java
public record ItemDto(String name, Integer stock) {}

// ItemsController.java
@RestController
@RequestMapping("/api")
public class ItemsController {
  @PostMapping("/items")
  public ResponseEntity<String> create(@RequestBody ItemDto dto) {
    return ResponseEntity.ok(dto.name() + "-" + dto.stock());
  }
}

// SecurityConfig.java
@Configuration
@EnableWebSecurity
public class SecurityConfig {
  @Bean
  SecurityFilterChain filterChain(HttpSecurity http) throws Exception {
    // minimal config (this is where I'm stuck)
    return http.build();
  }
}

Expected: POST should return 200 OK with the JSON.

What I tried:

http.csrf(csrf -> csrf.disable()); // unsure if safe for APIs
permitAll()

on /api/**, still getting 403.
